Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with plenty of water and light, showing it healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing it wilting or not growing well.
The student can draw a plant without light, showing it wilting or not growing well.
The student can use clear and simple symbols or labels to indicate the presence or absence of water in each drawing.
The student can use clear and simple symbols or labels to indicate the presence or absence of light in each drawing.
The student can illustrate a comparison between the plant with water and light, and the plant without water and/or light, highlighting the differences.
